page.title: 03Transport Buses St.Austell
page.content: Cornwall Busways has a bus and coach station adjoining the railway station at St.Austell, which is leased from British Rail. In 1985 forty-three staff are employed there, including twenty-eight drivers and five mechanics. Three types of bus are garaged at St. Austell - single deckers, double deckers and minibuses; but a representative of the Busways told us that in the near future, Cornwall will probably have only minibuses on local service routes.This is a good idea since many of our roads are narrow and winding,and there is traffic congestion in the summer when we have an influx of holiday makers with their cars, as well as those of local people. Also the minibuses are often large enough for the number of passengers carried on other buses.
